definition:
Let $S = \left\{ S_1,S_2,\dots S_n \right\}$ be a finite collection of
finite sets. A *system of distinct representatives*, or *SDR*, of $S$ is
a set $$x_1 \in S_1, x_2 \in S_2, \dots x_n \in S_n$$ such that
$$x_i \neq x_j \text{ whenever } i \neq j$$ (i.e., each choice must be
unique).
